result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J. Thompson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 1:34 pm
INCLUDES 16CM404, 16CM172, 16CM133, 16CM1254. 
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Paul Goetz;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
16CM404:
Ct. 2 (BJ)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (DC)>>DRI.

16CM172:
Ct. 2 (Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 Yrs)>>DRI.

16CM133:
Ct. 1 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)>>DRI.

16CM1254:
Ct. 1 (BJ)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
16CM404:
Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property)>> GUILTY.

16CM172:
Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>> GUILTY.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
PLEA: 
16CM404:
Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Restitution in the amount of $590 to be paid to J.K., Counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs. Court remits DNA Sample and Surcharge. 

16CM172:
Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>> $1760 fine inclusive. 60 Days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, CONCURRENT. Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 14 Months, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed immediately; IID installation fee to be paid; 14 Months dl revocation; AODA. Court finds 43 days credit. 

State to provide Restitution Order by end of day. 

Adjourned: 1:46 pm
Final pre-trial on August 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

INCLUDES 16CM172, 16CM133, & 16CM404 Absolute sobriety. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.   No contact with J.K.Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

Case Called: 9:39 am
INCLUDES 16CM133 AND 16CM172.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster for ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant does not appear. 

BW Continued.
COURT ORDERS: Court Forfeits $500 on 16CM172.

COURT VACATES BFH ON 16CM133.
Bond Continues.

Adj: 9:41 am

Case Called: 2:42 pm
INCLUDES 16CM133 AND 16CM172.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence. Defendant does not appear.
Date and time set for a Final Pretrial.
State requests a BW.
COURT AUTHORIZES BW $500 to cover both files.
BFH: 4/18/2016 @ 9:00 am
Adj: 2:42 pm

Pre-trial conference at 03-07-2016 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 03-17-2016 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial at 04-27-2016 09:00 am.

Includes Case 16CM133 and Case 16CM172.    Shall not consume alcohol.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 on or before 2/8/16.
